column5: Moe Whytock & I headed up to Port Elgin to meet Garry at the Hatchery & pick up the Salmon to deliver to Peninsula Shores District School in Wiarton, I met my father & invited him a long to the school as he lives in Wiarton now & could help with delivering food or equipment if needed, Richard Gawel a member of the BPSA & LHFC has worked to get an Aquarium in the Wiarton School, we were welcomed with a wolf cheer after introductions & 2 of the Students dumped the Salmon into the Classes Hatchery.http://lhfcschoolhatcheries.blogspot.ca/2014/01/peninsula-shores-district-school-wiarton.htmlThen it was off to Walkerton District Community School to set up our last school of the year, there are 3 classes helping to take care of the Salmon & have decided to set it up in the Library for all to enjoy, one of the Students from each of the Classes helped dump the Salmon into the Hatchery.http://lhfcschoolhatcheries.blogspot.ca/2014/01/walkerton-district-community-school.htmlHope you enjoyed the little video Tight Lines Richard
You guys do an awesome job Richard! Looking to receive some photos for this month's newsletter!  Send them to me whenever you can!  Thanks! -Eugene-
Hey Eugene I sent a couple & will hopefully have more on Monday. Tight Lines SBK
Always look forward to them Richard!
Cool that's an awesome program !!!! Keep up the great work !!!! The kids just love that kind I stuff and it educates !!!! Win win for everyone including the salmon !!!!! Thanks for sharing

Cool that's an awesome program !!!! Keep up the great work !!!! The kids just love that kind I stuff and it educates !!!! Win win for everyone including the salmon !!!!! Thanks for sharing  You're totally right! It's a win-win for everyone involved. It's so evident that kids have a huge interest with this program and I wish the program all the success in the world. Helping kids to understand and for them to see it first hand is a great way for continued success!
